channel.title: Removing the afk timer of 60 seconds?:o
channel.description: Title says all (for all uneducated people)- Where would i find the timer for i guess, afk(?) time, so if 60 seconds is up, it will disconnect the ip?

item.title: Removing the afk timer of 60 seconds?:o
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

Thank you cexi!

uhm i found:

case 0: break; // idle packet - keeps on reseting timeOutCounter case 202: // idle logout packet if(!inCombat) logout(); break;

right off the bat and i meant “idle” instead of “afk” sorry

Read full topic
item.source: Removing the afk timer of 60 seconds?:o

item.title: Removing the afk timer of 60 seconds?:o
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The packets in delta are done through a switch method, so packet 252 for example would be case 252:[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 05, 2009, 08:38:43 pm[/size][hr]This is what you will be searching for in client.java

switch (packetType) {

I use delta and packet1 is not there, so i am looking through them for the “afk” packet for your

Read full topic

if (showpackets == 1) {
System.out.println("packet: " + l);
System.out.println("packet1: " + j);
}

that’s basically all relating to packet 1, and nothing in subfolders
:o 1 min ill look somemo.re

ANYWAYS… Look in your client folder for any subfolders relating to packets of data? :x
